2 Machabees *__01.9__Scenopegia: : Viz., the Encenia, or feast of the dedication of the altar, called here Scenopegia, or feast of tabernacles, from being celebrated with the like solemnity.
2 Machabees *__01.11__Such a king: : Viz., Antiochus Sidetes, who began to make war upon the Jews, whilst Simon was yet alive. 1 Mac. 15. 39. And afterwards besieged Jerusalem under John Hircanus. So that the Judas here mentioned, ver. 10, is not Judas Machabeus, who was dead long before the year 188 of the kingdom of the Greeks, for he died in the year 146 of that epoch, (see above 1 Mac. chap. 2., ver. 70, also the note on chap. 1, ver. 2,) but either Judas the eldest son of John Hircanus, or Judas the Essene, renowned for the gift of prophecy, who flourished about that time.
2 Machabees *__01.13__Nanea: : A Persian goddess, which some have taken for Diana, others for Venus.
2 Machabees *__01.19__Persia: : Babylonia, called here Persia, from being afterwards a part of the Persian empire.
2 Machabees *__01.34__A temple: : That is, an enclosure, or a wall round about the place where the fire was hid, to separate it from profane uses, to the end that it might be respected as a holy place.
